title: PFL 2019, Playoffs 1 predictions: Is Kayla Harrison vs. Sarah Kaufman an automatic final?
text:
The 2019 PFL playoffs get underway Friday, with the women’s lightweight and men’s welterweight brackets set to fight until a final is determined.

Unlike the other playoff brackets, women’s lightweight consists of four fighters, meaning just a pair of semifinals will take place. In one, top seed Sarah Kaufman takes on No. 4 Larissa Pacheco. And in the other semifinal, No. 2 Kayla Harrison meets Genah Fabian.

Meanwhile, at welterweight, an eight-man bracket will play itself out led by No. 1 Glaico Franca vs. No. 8 Andre Fialho. The winner meets the winner of No. 4 John Howard vs. No. 5 David Michaud. In the bottom half of the bracket, defending champion Magomed Magomedkerimov, who’s seeded No. 2, takes on No. 7 Chris Curtis, with the winner squaring off against the winner of No. 3 Sadibou Sy vs. No. 6 Ray Cooper III, last year’s runner up.

Here’s a look at each bracket.

Women’s lightweight

Welterweight

PFL 2019, Playoffs 1 takes place at Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, and the card streams on ESPN+ and airs on ESPN2. You can check out the MMA Junkie staff’s predictions below:
